intro: Pyrola asarifolia var. japonica, commonly known as Japanese snow bell, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has evergreen foliage with dark green, leathery leaves that remain throughout the year. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky slopes. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and woodland plantings.
